data.title: Condolence Message from Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on the passing of Former President and Prime Minister of Mauritius Sir Anerood Jugnauth, 8 June 2021
meta_keywords: The text of the letter is appended.
data.meta_description: Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has written to Prime Minister of Mauritius Pravind Kumar Jugnauth to convey his condolences on the passing of former President and Prime Minister of Mauritius Sir Anerood Jugnauth.
data.text:
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has written to Prime Minister of Mauritius Pravind Kumar Jugnauth to convey his condolences on the passing of former President and Prime Minister of Mauritius Sir Anerood Jugnauth. The text of the letter is appended.

. . . . .

MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS

SINGAPORE

8 JUNE 2021

Condolence Letter from Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong to Mauritian Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth

7 June 2021

Dear Prime Minister Jugnauth,

I am deeply saddened to learn of the passing of your father, former Prime Minister and President Sir Anerood Jugnauth.

In his long and illustrious career, Sir Anerood worked tirelessly to advance Mauritiusâ€™ development, and transformed it into one of the most prosperous and developed countries in Africa.

We will always remember Sir Anerood as a friend of Singapore. He was a strong supporter of closer relations between our countries and enjoyed warm personal ties with many past and present Singapore leaders. Under his leadership, Singapore and Mauritius collaborated on numerous projects and concluded agreements that deepened our bilateral trade and aviation links, including the Bilateral Investment Treaty and the Air Services Agreement.

On behalf of the Government of Singapore, I extend my deepest condolences to you and your family, and to the Government and people of Mauritius.

Yours sincerely,

LEE HSIEN LOONG

The Honourable Pravind Kumar Jugnauth

Prime Minister

Minister of Defence, Home Affairs and External Communications

Minister for Rodrigues, Outer Islands and Territorial Integrity

Republic of Mauritius

. . . . .
